content:
GlobalCatalog Class

In this Article

The GlobalCatalog class represents a global catalog server. A global catalog server is a domain controller that hosts a replica of the global catalog.

Syntax

Declaration

public class GlobalCatalog : System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainController

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DirectoryServer
  • System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainController
  • GlobalCatalog

,

Methods summary

DisableGlobalCatalog()

Demotes this domain controller from a global catalog server.
EnableGlobalCatalog()

Not supported for the GlobalCatalog class because this domain controller is already a global catalog server.
FindAll(DirectoryContext)

Finds all global catalog servers in the specified context.
FindAll(DirectoryContext,String)

Finds all global catalog servers in the specified context and site.
FindAllProperties()

Retrieves all of the Active Directory Domain Services properties that are stored on this global catalog server.
FindOne(DirectoryContext)

Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context.
FindOne(DirectoryContext,LocatorOptions)

Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context, allowing for additional search options.
FindOne(DirectoryContext,String)

Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context and site.
FindOne(DirectoryContext,String,LocatorOptions)

Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context and site, allowing for additional search options.
GetDirectorySearcher()

Retrieves a DirectorySearcher object for the global catalog server.
GetGlobalCatalog(DirectoryContext)

Retrieves a GlobalCatalog object for the specified context.
IsGlobalCatalog()

Determines if this domain controller is a global catalog server.

Methods

  • DisableGlobalCatalog()

    Demotes this domain controller from a global catalog server.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainController DisableGlobalCatalog ();

    Returns

    • System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DomainController

      A DomainController object that represents the domain controller.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The domain controller is not a global catalog server or the global catalog server has already been disabled.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The current object has been disposed.

  • EnableGlobalCatalog()

    Not supported for the GlobalCatalog class because this domain controller is already a global catalog server.

    public override System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalog EnableGlobalCatalog ();

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalog

      Not applicable. This method will always throw an InvalidOperationException exception.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The domain controller is already a global catalog server.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The current object has been disposed.

  • FindAll(DirectoryContext)

    Finds all global catalog servers in the specified context.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalogCollection FindAll (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search. The target of the context must be a forest.

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalogCollection

      A GlobalCatalogCollection object that contains the global catalog servers found by the search.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      context is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context is null.

  • FindAll(DirectoryContext,String)

    Finds all global catalog servers in the specified context and site.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalogCollection FindAll (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string siteName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      An DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search. The target of the context must be a forest.

    • siteName
      String

      The name of the site to search for global catalog servers.

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalogCollection

      A GlobalCatalogCollection object that contains the global catalog servers found by the search.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      context or siteName is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or siteName is null.

  • FindAllProperties()

    Retrieves all of the Active Directory Domain Services properties that are stored on this global catalog server.

    public System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection FindAllProperties ();

    Returns

    • ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection

      A ReadOnlyActiveDirectorySchemaPropertyCollection object that contains the Active Directory Domain Services properties that are stored on this global catalog server.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The domain controller is not a global catalog server or the global catalog server has been disabled.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The current object has been disposed.

    Example

    The following C# example shows how to enumerate the global catalog servers in the specified DirectoryContext object and print the common name of each property stored on each global catalog server to the standard console. 

    
foreach (GlobalCatalog gc in GlobalCatalog.FindAll(context))  
{  
    Console.WriteLine(gc.Name);  

    foreach (ActiveDirectorySchemaProperty prop in gc.FindAllProperties())  
    {  
        Console.WriteLine(prop.CommonName);  
    }  
}
  • FindOne(DirectoryContext)

    Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalog FindOne (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search.

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalog

      A GlobalCatalog object that represents the global catalog server found by the search.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      No global catalog server was found.

    • ArgumentException

      context is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context is null.

  • FindOne(DirectoryContext,LocatorOptions)

    Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context, allowing for additional search options.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalog FindOne (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.LocatorOptions flag);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search.

    • flag
      LocatorOptions

      A combination of one or more of the LocatorOptions members that defines the type of global catalog server to find.

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalog

      A GlobalCatalog object that represents the global catalog server found by the search.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      No global catalog server was found.

    • ArgumentException

      context or flag is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context is null.

  • FindOne(DirectoryContext,String)

    Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context and site.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalog FindOne (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string siteName);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search.

    • siteName
      String

      The name of the site to search for a global catalog server.

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalog

      A GlobalCatalog object that represents the global catalog server found by the search.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      No global catalog server was found.

    • ArgumentException

      context or siteName is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or siteName is null.

  • FindOne(DirectoryContext,String,LocatorOptions)

    Finds a single global catalog server in the specified context and site, allowing for additional search options.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalog FindOne (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context, string siteName, System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.LocatorOptions flag);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      A DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use for the search.

    • siteName
      String

      The name of the site to search for a global catalog server.

    • flag
      LocatorOptions

      A combination of one or more of the LocatorOptions members that defines the type of global catalog server to find.

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalog

      A GlobalCatalog object that represents the global catalog server found by the search.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      No global catalog server was found.

    • ArgumentException

      context, siteName, or flag is not valid.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context or siteName is null.

  • GetDirectorySearcher()

    Retrieves a DirectorySearcher object for the global catalog server.

    public override System.DirectoryServices.DirectorySearcher GetDirectorySearcher ();

    Returns

    • DirectorySearcher

      A DirectorySearcher object for the global catalog server.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The global catalog server has been disabled.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The current object has been disposed.

  • GetGlobalCatalog(DirectoryContext)

    Retrieves a GlobalCatalog object for the specified context.

    public static System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.GlobalCatalog GetGlobalCatalog (System.DirectoryServices.ActiveDirectory.DirectoryContext context);

    Parameters

    • context
      DirectoryContext

      An DirectoryContext object that contains the target and credentials to use to retrieve the object. The target of the context must be a domain controller.

    Returns

    • GlobalCatalog

      An GlobalCatalog object that represents the global catalog server that was found.

    Exceptions

    • ActiveDirectoryObjectNotFoundException

      A connection to the target specified in context could not be made.

    • ArgumentNullException

      context is null.

    • ArgumentException

      context is not valid.

  • IsGlobalCatalog()

    Determines if this domain controller is a global catalog server.

    public override bool IsGlobalCatalog ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if this domain controller is a global catalog server; false if it is not a global catalog server.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The global catalog server has been disabled.

    • ObjectDisposedException

      The current object has been disposed.
